de.pbma.nearfly

Class NearflyServiceOld

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • de.pbma.nearfly.NearflyServiceOld
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public class NearflyServiceOld
extends android.app.Service
    A Bound Service that wrap up the feature functions from the Google Nearby API and MQTT Paho.

    The NeaflyService is started according to the usual procedure for starting bound service via ContextWrapper.startService(Intent)}. After the activity is bound, NearflyService can be used. In order to facilitate the integration of the NeaflyService the Activity can inherit from the NearflyBindingActivity.

    Usage Examples

    Here is an example of an activity that extends from the NearflyBindingActivity and publishes message as soon as it is connected to the NeaflyService. 

     

 public class NearflySampleActivity extends NearflyBindingActivity {

     private final String NEARFLY_CHANNEL = "sensors/humidity";
     private boolean neaflyServiceConnectCalled = false;

     \@Override
     public void onNearflyServiceUnbound() {
         if (!neaflyServiceConnectCalled) {
             nearflyService.addSubCallback(nearflyListener);
             nearflyService.connect("ThisIsMyUniqueRoomString", NearflyService.USE_NEARBY);
             nearflyService.subIt(NEARFLY_CHANNEL);
             neaflyServiceConnectCalled = true;
         }
     }

     \@Override
     public void onNearflyServiceUnbound() {
     }

     NearflyListener nearflyListener = new NearflyListener() {
    Author:
    Alexis Danilo Morgado dos Santos

      • pubIt

        public boolean pubIt(String channel,
                     String message,
                     Integer nice,
                     boolean retain)
        Deprecated. 
        Publishes the specified message to the respective channel in the specified room. Optionally a priority between -20 (Publishes that should arrive first) to 19 (Messages that should arrive last) can be assigned.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to be subscribed to
        message - the message to be published
        nice - (optional) the priority of the message to be published. (default 0)
        retain - (optional) if this is true, the message is kept until it can be published. (default false)
        Returns:
        false if publishing was aborted due to a nonexistent connection or exceeding the maximum size

      • pubFile

        public boolean pubFile(String channel,
                       android.net.Uri uri,
                       String textAttachment,
                       Integer nice,
                       boolean retain)
        Deprecated. 
        Publish the specified file in the specified uri to the to the respective channel in the specified room. Optionally a priority between -20 (Publishes that should arrive first) to 19 (Messages that should arrive last) can be assigned.

        Attention

        Calling this method requires the following permission to read and write the external storage:
        • android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE
        • android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE
        Parameters:
        channel - to unsubscribed channel
        uri - uri of the file to be published
        nice - (optional) priority of the message to be published.(default 0)
        retain - (optional) if this is true, the message is kept until it can be published. The file is not cached, only the uri. (default false)

      • pubFile

        public boolean pubFile(String channel,
                       android.net.Uri uri,
                       String textAttachment)
        Deprecated. 
        See Also:
        pubFile(String, Uri, String, Integer, boolean)

      • connect

        public void connect(String room,
                    int connectionMode)
        Deprecated. 
        Initializes the connection to the technology currently in use. If NearflyServiceOld.ConnectionMode USE_MQTT is used, an attempt is made to establish a connection to the MQTT broker. If USE_NEARBY is used as NearflyServiceOld.ConnectionMode the automatic construction process of a peer-to-peer network is initiated or a network that uses the same room string is joined.

        ATTENTION

        The roomstring should currently be left at 19moa18, since the hs-ma broker limits topics based on the student account and may not let other top-level topics through. limited and they will not be
        Parameters:
        room - All devices with the same number can connect to one another, while different devices are ignored. If the room is not specified, this corresponds to the canonical name of the user activity (not recommended)
        connectionMode - technology to be used

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Deprecated. 
        See Also:
        connect(String, int)

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Deprecated. 
        Disconnects the connection to the MQTT broker when in NearflyServiceOld.ConnectionMode USE_MQTT. in NearflyServiceOld.ConnectionMode USE_NEARBY, the connection to all connected endpoints is disconnected.

      • addSubCallback

        public boolean addSubCallback(NearflyListener nearflyListener)
        Deprecated. 
        Adds a NearflyListener to the NearflyService, which is triggered for all future incoming messages on all subscribed channels and to status messages like connect and disconnect. The NearflyListener does not offer the possibility to react to certain of the subscribed channels. However, this can easily be implemented by the user.

        Parameters:
        nearflyListener - listener to respond to issues from NearflyService
        Returns:
        true if the nearflyListener was added

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the nearflyListener was added before.

      • switchConnectionMode

        public boolean switchConnectionMode(int destConnectionMode)
        Deprecated. 
        Allows changing the NearflyServiceOld.ConnectionMode without reconnecting to the . The current used underlying technology is only disconnected, when the {link #destConnectionMode} technology has been successfully connected. Is there an error, e.g. on the part of MQTT, since there is no internet, the process is canceled. Note that nearby connections sometimes turns on the hotspot and interferes with MQTT, since MQTT may not have internet in this case. if this happens you can repeat the process. IsModeSwitching() can be used to query whether the switching process is still running. Note that when you switch to Nearby, the techSwitch is complete when a network with 2 nodes has been set up. Messages that are published during the switch will therefore not reach everyone.
        Parameters:
        destConnectionMode - NearflyServiceOld.ConnectionMode to which to switch
        Returns:
        false if is already in the desired NearflyServiceOld.ConnectionMode
